meanings.definition: Planks of wood taken from old barns.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used barnboards to build a new fence.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was made of weathered barnboards.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the chickens wanted to roost on the barnboards instead of inside.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like barnboards, weathered but sturdy.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the barnboards brought back childhood summers on the farm.

meanings.definition: The boards used in constructing a barn.
meanings.sent1: Dad stacked the barnboards neatly for the barn renovation.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter selected the finest barnboards for the new structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to climb the barnboards and nap on the roof.
meanings.sent4: The barnboards stood tall against the storm, protecting the animals inside.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind whistling through the barnboards was soothing on a quiet evening.
